intro: Zeocriton, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, golden-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Zeocriton is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
